00098 /* Because array size can't be a const in C, the following two are macros.
00099    Both sizes are in bytes. */
00100 #define AES_MAXNR 14
00101 #define AES_BLOCK_SIZE 16

00113   /* This should be a hidden type, but EVP requires that the size be known */
00114   struct aes_key_st {
00115     unsigned long rd_key[4 * (AES_MAXNR + 1)];
00116     int rounds;
00117 #ifdef OCTEON_OPENSSL
00118     uint64_t cvmkey[4];
00119     int cvm_keylen;
00120 #endif
00121   };

00220   /* These are API's exposed */
00221   int cvm_crypto_aes_xcbc_mac (uint64_t * key, uint32_t bits,
00222     uint64_t * data, uint32_t dlen, uint64_t * mac);
00223   int cvm_crypto_aes_xcbc_prf128 (uint64_t * orgkey, uint32_t bits,
00224     uint64_t * data, uint32_t dlen, uint64_t * mac);
00225   int cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_encrypt (uint64_t * key, uint32_t bits,
00226     uint64_t orgiv, uint32_t nonce, uint64_t * data, uint32_t dlen,
00227     uint64_t * res);
00228 
00229 /** 
00230  * RFC3686 implementation,parameter types are same as in cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_encrypt
00231  * @param key pointer to key 
00232  * @param bits length of key in bits (should be 16*8 or 24*8 or 32*8)
00233  * @param orgiv eight byte initial vector
00234  * @param nonce initial nonce(refer RFC 3686)
00235  * @param data data pointer
00236  * @param dlen length of data in bytes
00237  * @param res pointer to byte array where result of decryption should be written
00238  * @return 0 on success, -1 on failure
00239  */
00240   static inline int cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_decrypt (uint64_t * key,
00241     uint32_t bits, uint64_t orgiv, uint32_t nonce, uint64_t * data,
00242     uint32_t dlen, uint64_t * res) {
00243     return cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_encrypt (key, bits, orgiv, nonce, data, dlen,
00244       res);
00245   }
00246   /* MultiCall API's */
00247     int cvm_crypto_aes_xcbc_mac_init (uint8_t * orgkey, uint32_t bits,
00248     AES_KEY * key, AES_XCBC_MAC_CTX * ctx);
00249   int cvm_crypto_aes_xcbc_mac_update (AES_KEY * key, uint8_t * data,
00250     uint32_t dlen, AES_XCBC_MAC_CTX * ctx);
00251   int cvm_crypto_aes_xcbc_mac_final (AES_KEY * key, AES_XCBC_MAC_CTX * ctx,
00252     uint64_t * mac);
00253 
00254   int cvm_crypto_aes_xcbc_prf128_init (uint8_t * orgkey, uint32_t bits,
00255     AES_KEY * key, AES_XCBC_MAC_CTX * ctx);
00256   int cvm_crypto_aes_xcbc_prf128_update (AES_KEY * key, uint8_t * data,
00257     uint32_t dlen, AES_XCBC_MAC_CTX * ctx);
00258   int cvm_crypto_aes_xcbc_prf128_final (AES_KEY * key,
00259     AES_XCBC_MAC_CTX * ctx, uint64_t * mac);
00260 
00261   int cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_encrypt_init (uint8_t * orgkey, uint32_t bits,
00262     AES_KEY * key, uint64_t iv, uint32_t nonce, void *state);
00263   int cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_encrypt_update (AES_KEY * key, uint8_t * data,
00264     uint32_t dlen, uint8_t * res, void *state);
00265   int cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_encrypt_final (AES_KEY * key, uint8_t * data,
00266     uint32_t dlen, uint8_t * res, void *state);
00267 
00268 /**
00269  * RFC3686 implementation,Multicall fashion
00270  * @param orgkey pointer to key
00271  * @param bits length of key in bits (128,192,256 are only allowed values)
00272  * @param key pointer to AES_KEY structure to be initialized
00273  * @param nonce initial nonce(refer RFC 3686)
00274  * @param iv 8 byte initialization vector
00275  * @param state pointer to Pre-Allocated AES_CTR_CTX structure,opaque quantity to user
00276  * @return 0 on success,-1 on failure
00277  */
00278 
00279   static inline int cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_decrypt_init (uint8_t * orgkey,
00280     uint32_t bits, AES_KEY * key, uint64_t iv, uint32_t nonce,
00281     void *state) {
00282     return cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_encrypt_init (orgkey, bits, key, iv, nonce,
00283       state);
00284   }
00285 
00286 
00287 /**
00288  * RFC3686 implementation,Multicall fashion
00289  * @param key pointer to AES_KEY structure passed to cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_init function
00290  * @param data pointer to text to be encrypted
00291  * @param dlen length of data pointed to by data. If dlen is not a multiple of 16 this is considered as the final call,no further update/final functions should be called
00292  * @param dlen Note that if total dlen is a multiple of 16, atleast one final call is mandatory 
00293  * @param res pointer to decrypted text to be written
00294  * @param state Pre-allocated AES_CTR_CTX pointer that was passed to init function
00295  * @return 0 on success, -1 on failure
00296  */
00297 
00298   static inline int cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_decrypt_update (AES_KEY * key,
00299     uint8_t * data, uint32_t dlen, uint8_t * res, void *state) {
00300     return cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_encrypt_update (key, data, dlen, res, state);
00301   }
00302 
00303 /**
00304  * RFC3686 implementation,Multicall fashion
00305  * After this call no update/final should be called
00306  * @param key pointer to AES_KEY structure passed to cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_init function
00307  * @param data pointer to text to be decrypted
00308  * @param dlen length of data pointed to by data(should be non-zero).
00309  * @param dlen Note that if total dlen is a multiple of 16, atleast one final call is mandatory 
00310  * @param res pointer to location where decrypted text should be written
00311  * @param state AES_CTR_CTX pointer that was passed to init function
00312  * @return 0 on success, -1 on failure
00313  */
00314 
00315   static inline int cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_decrypt_final (AES_KEY * key,
00316     uint8_t * data, uint32_t dlen, uint8_t * res, void *state) {
00317     return cvm_crypto_aes_ctr_encrypt_final (key, data, dlen, res, state);
00318   }
00319 
00320   typedef union {
00321     uint64_t val64[2];
00322     uint32_t val32[4];
00323     uint8_t val8[16];
00324   } block16_t;
00325 
00326   typedef union {
00327     uint64_t val64[4];
00328     uint32_t val32[8];
00329     uint8_t val8[32];
00330   } block32_t;
00331 
00332   typedef struct aes_gcm_ctx_type {
00333     // Counter value Y_i (128 bits)
00334     block16_t Y_i;
00335 
00336     // AES Key (128, 192, or 256 bits)
00337     block32_t K;
00338 
00339     // H (128 bits)
00340     block16_t H;
00341 
00342     // (used at the end to XOR with GHASH output to form auth tag)
00343     uint32_t Y_0;
00344 
00345     // AES key length
00346     uint32_t keylen;
00347 
00348     // state
00349     uint32_t done;
00350 
00351   } aes_gcm_ctx_t;
00352 
00353 #define AES_GCM_KEY_DONE         0xAC
00354 #define AES_GCM_IV_DONE          0xBD
00355 
00356   // Return codes
00357 #define AES_GCM_SUCCESS              0
00358 #define AES_GCM_INVALID_KEYLENGTH   -1
00359 #define AES_GCM_INVALID_CTX         -2
00360 #define AES_GCM_IV_NOT_SET          -3
00361 #define AES_GCM_KEY_NOT_SET         -4
00362 #define AES_GCM_NOT_SUPPORTED       -5
00363 
00364 /**
00365  * AES GCM Initialization of the key
00366  * @param key pointer to Key of size keylen bits (Input)
00367  * @param keylen Length of the key in bits (Input)
00368  * @param aes_ctx pointer to aes_gcm_ctx_t structure. 
00369  *        This is an opaque pointer to the user (Input)
00370  * @return AES_GCM_SUCCESS (0)             
00371  *         AES_GCM_INVALID_KEYLENGTH (-1)
00372  */
00373   int AES_GCM_init_key (uint8_t * key, uint32_t keylen,
00374     aes_gcm_ctx_t * aes_ctx);
00375 /**
00376  * AES GCM Set the IV
00377  * @param iv pointer to "iv" of size "ivlen" bytes (Input)
00378  * @param ivlen Length of the iv in bytes (Input)
00379  * @param aes_ctx pointer to aes_gcm_ctx_t structure. 
00380  *        This is an opaque pointer to the user (Input)
00381  * @return AES_GCM_SUCCESS (0)             
00382  *         AES_GCM_INVALID_CTX (-2)
00383  *         AES_GCM_KEY_NOT_SET (-4)
00384  */
00385   int AES_GCM_set_iv (uint8_t * iv, uint32_t ivlen,
00386     aes_gcm_ctx_t * aes_ctx);
00387 
00388 /**
00389  * AES GCM Encryption + Authentication operation 
00390  *          (Multiple calls for same key)
00391  *          This encrypts plain input and authenticates the input
00392  *          authentication data. One or both of these inputs can
00393  *          be given together.
00394  * @param pin pointer to Plain input of size "plen" bytes (Input)
00395  * @param plen Length of the Plain input in bytes (Input)
00396  * @param ain pointer to Authentication data of size "alen" bytes (Input)
00397  * @param alen Length of the Authentication data in bytes (Input)
00398  * @param out pointer to Ciphered output of size "plen" bytes (Output)
00399  * @param tag Pointer to 16 bytes of generated authentication tag (Output)
00400  * @param aes_ctx pointer to aes_gcm_ctx_t structure. 
00401  *        This is an opaque pointer to the user (Input)
00402  * @return AES_GCM_SUCCESS (0)             
00403  *         AES_GCM_INVALID_CTX (-2)
00404  *         AES_GCM_IV_NOT_SET  (-3)
00405  *         AES_GCM_KEY_NOT_SET (-4)
00406  */
00407   int AES_GCM_ctx_encrypt (uint8_t * pin, uint32_t plen,
00408     uint8_t * ain, uint32_t alen,
00409     uint8_t * out, uint8_t * tag, aes_gcm_ctx_t * aes_ctx);
00410 /**
00411  * AES GCM Decryption + Authentication operation
00412  *          (Multiple calls for same key)
00413  *          This decrypts ciphered input and authenticates the input
00414  *          authentication data. One or both of these inputs can
00415  *          be given together.
00416  * @param cin pointer to Ciphered input of size "clen" bytes (Input)
00417  * @param clen Length of the Ciphered input in bytes (Input)
00418  * @param ain pointer to Authentication data of size "alen" bytes (Input)
00419  * @param alen Length of the Authentication data in bytes (Input)
00420  * @param out pointer to Plain output of size "clen" bytes (Output)
00421  * @param tag Pointer to 16 bytes of generated authentication tag (Output)
00422  * @param aes_ctx pointer to aes_gcm_ctx_t structure. 
00423  *        This is an opaque pointer to the user (Input)
00424  * @return AES_GCM_SUCCESS (0)             
00425  *         AES_GCM_INVALID_KEYLENGTH (-1)
00426  *         AES_GCM_INVALID_CTX (-2)
00427  *         AES_GCM_IV_NOT_SET  (-3)
00428  *         AES_GCM_KEY_NOT_SET (-4)
00429  */
00430   int AES_GCM_ctx_decrypt (uint8_t * cin, uint32_t clen,
00431     uint8_t * ain, uint32_t alen,
00432     uint8_t * out, uint8_t * tag, aes_gcm_ctx_t * aes_ctx);
00433 /**
00434  * AES GCM Encryption + Authentication operation
00435  *          This encrypts plain input and authenticates the input
00436  *          authentication data. One or both of these inputs can
00437  *          be given together.
00438  * @param key pointer to Key of size keylen bits (Input)
00439  * @param keylen Length of the key in bits (Input)
00440  * @param iv pointer to "iv" of size "ivlen" bytes (Input)
00441  * @param ivlen Length of the iv in bytes (Input)
00442  * @param ain pointer to Authentication data of size "alen" bytes (Input)
00443  * @param alen Length of the Authentication data in bytes (Input)
00444  * @param pin pointer to Plain input of size "plen" bytes (Input)
00445  * @param plen Length of the Plain input in bytes (Input)
00446  * @param out pointer to Ciphered output of size "plen" bytes (Output)
00447  * @param tag Pointer to 16 bytes of generated authentication tag (Output)
00448  * @return AES_GCM_SUCCESS (0)             
00449  *         AES_GCM_INVALID_KEYLENGTH (-1)
00450  *         AES_GCM_INVALID_CTX (-2)
00451  *         AES_GCM_IV_NOT_SET  (-3)
00452  *         AES_GCM_KEY_NOT_SET (-4)
00453  */
00454   int AES_GCM_encrypt (uint8_t * key, uint32_t keylen, uint8_t * iv,
00455     uint32_t ivlen, uint8_t * ain, uint32_t alen, uint8_t * pin,
00456     uint32_t plen, uint8_t * out, uint8_t * tag);
00457 /**
00458  * AES GCM Decryption + Authentication operation
00459  *          This decrypts ciphered input and authenticates the input
00460  *          authentication data. One or both of these inputs can
00461  *          be given together.
00462  * @param key pointer to Key of size keylen bits (Input)
00463  * @param keylen Length of the key in bits (Input)
00464  * @param iv pointer to "iv" of size "ivlen" bytes (Input)
00465  * @param ivlen Length of the iv in bytes (Input)
00466  * @param cin pointer to Ciphered input of size "clen" bytes (Input)
00467  * @param clen Length of the Ciphered input in bytes (Input)
00468  * @param ain pointer to Authentication data of size "alen" bytes (Input)
00469  * @param alen Length of the Authentication data in bytes (Input)
00470  * @param out pointer to Plain output of size "clen" bytes (Output)
00471  * @param tag Pointer to 16 bytes of generated authentication tag (Output)
00472  * @return AES_GCM_SUCCESS (0)             
00473  *         AES_GCM_INVALID_KEYLENGTH (-1)
00474  *         AES_GCM_INVALID_CTX (-2)
00475  *         AES_GCM_IV_NOT_SET  (-3)
00476  *         AES_GCM_KEY_NOT_SET (-4)
00477  */
00478   int AES_GCM_decrypt (uint8_t * key, uint32_t keylen, uint8_t * iv,
00479     uint32_t ivlen, uint8_t * ain, uint32_t alen, uint8_t * cin,
00480     uint32_t clen, uint8_t * out, uint8_t * tag);
00481 
00482   typedef struct {
00483     // Key 1 ( first 128, 192 or 256 bits)
00484     block32_t K1;
00485 
00486     // Key 2 (last 128 bits)
00487     block16_t K2;
00488 
00489     // Key1 Length (Total key length - 128)
00490     uint32_t K1_len;
00491 
00492     // Last Tweak value used
00493     block16_t tweak;
00494 
00495     // state
00496     uint32_t init_done;
00497 
00498   } lrw_aes_ctx_t;
00499 
00500 #define LRW_AES_SUCCESS              0
00501 #define LRW_AES_INVALID_KEYLENGTH   -1
00502 #define LRW_AES_INVALID_CTX         -2
00503 #define LRW_AES_INVALID_LENGTH      -3
00504 
00505 #define LRW_KEY_DONE                0xBEAD
00506 
00507 /**
00508  * LRW AES Sets the key in the context
00509  * @param key pointer to Key of size keylen bits (Input)
00510  * @param keylen Length of the key in bits(Valid values: 256,320,384)(Input)
00511  * @param i Pointer to 16 byte Initial tweak value (Input)
00512  * @param lrw_ctx pointer to lrw_aes_ctx_t structure. 
00513  *        This is an opaque pointer to the user (Input)
00514  * @return LRW_AES_SUCCESS (0)             
00515  *         LRW_AES_INVALID_KEYLENGTH (-1)
00516  */
00517   int LRW_AES_set_key (uint8_t * key, uint32_t keylen, uint8_t * i,
00518     lrw_aes_ctx_t * lrw_ctx);
00519 /**
00520  * LRW AES Encryption (Multiple calls for same key)
00521  *          This encrypts plain input.
00522  * @param pin pointer to Plain input of size "plen" bytes (Input)
00523  * @param plen Length of the Plain input in bytes (Input)
00524  * @param out pointer to Ciphered output of size "plen" bytes (Output)
00525  * @param lrw_ctx pointer to lrw_aes_ctx_t structure. 
00526  *        This is an opaque pointer to the user (Input)
00527  * @return LRW_AES_SUCCESS (0)             
00528  *         LRW_AES_INVALID_CTX (-2)
00529  *         LRW_AES_INVALID_LENGTH (-3)
00530  */
00531   int LRW_AES_ctx_encrypt (uint8_t * pin, uint32_t plen, uint8_t * out,
00532     lrw_aes_ctx_t * lrw_ctx);
00533 /**
00534  * LRW AES Decryption (Multiple calls for same key)
00535  *          This decrypts Ciphered input.
00536  * @param cin pointer to Ciphered input of size "clen" bytes (Input)
00537  * @param clen Length of the Ciphered input in bytes (Input)
00538  * @param out pointer to Plain output of size "clen" bytes (Output)
00539  * @param lrw_ctx pointer to lrw_aes_ctx_t structure. 
00540  *        This is an opaque pointer to the user (Input)
00541  * @return LRW_AES_SUCCESS (0)             
00542  *         LRW_AES_INVALID_CTX (-2)
00543  *         LRW_AES_INVALID_LENGTH (-3)
00544  */
00545   int LRW_AES_ctx_decrypt (uint8_t * cin, uint32_t clen, uint8_t * out,
00546     lrw_aes_ctx_t * lrw_ctx);
00547 /**
00548  * LRW AES Encryption 
00549  *          This encrypts plain input.
00550  * @param key pointer to Key of size keylen bits (Input)
00551  * @param keylen Length of the key in bits (Input)
00552  * @param i Pointer to 16 byte Initial tweak value (Input)
00553  * @param pin pointer to Plain input of size "plen" bytes (Input)
00554  * @param plen Length of the Plain input in bytes (Input)
00555  * @param out pointer to Ciphered output of size "plen" bytes (Output)
00556  * @return LRW_AES_SUCCESS (0)             
00557  *         LRW_AES_INVALID_KEYLENGTH (-1)
00558  *         LRW_AES_INVALID_CTX (-2)
00559  *         LRW_AES_INVALID_LENGTH (-3)
00560  */
00561   int LRW_AES_encrypt (uint8_t * key, uint32_t keylen, uint8_t * p,
00562     uint32_t plen, uint8_t * tweak, uint8_t * out);
00563 /**
00564  * LRW AES Decryption 
00565  *          This decrypts Ciphered input.
00566  * @param key pointer to Key of size keylen bits (Input)

00568  * @param cin pointer to Ciphered input of size "clen" bytes (Input)
00569  * @param clen Length of the Ciphered input in bytes (Input)
00570  * @param out pointer to Plain output of size "clen" bytes (Output)
00571  * @return LRW_AES_SUCCESS (0)             
00572  *         LRW_AES_INVALID_KEYLENGTH (-1)
00573  *         LRW_AES_INVALID_CTX (-2)
00574  *         LRW_AES_INVALID_LENGTH (-3)
00575  */
00576   int LRW_AES_decrypt (uint8_t * key, uint32_t keylen, uint8_t * c,
00577     uint32_t clen, uint8_t * tweak, uint8_t * out);
00578 
00579 #define AES_CBC_SHA_SUCCESS             0
00580 #define AES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_ARGUMENT   -1
00581 #define AES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_KEYLENGTH  -2
00582 #define AES_CBC_SHA_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL   -3
00583 
00584 /** 
00585  * AES-CBC-SHA1 Encryption
00586  * This function creates an IPSEC outbound packet using AES-CBC & HMAC-SHA1 keys provided
00587  * @param aes_keylen   [in] AES CBC encryption key length
00588  * @param aes_key      [in] AES CBC encryption key
00589  * @param sha1_keylen  [in] HMAC-SHA1 key length
00590  * @param sha1_key     [in] HMAC-SHA1 key
00591  * @param espheader    [in] Pointer to the ESP header (must be of 8 bytes in 
00592  * length). It is placed at the start of the output packet.
00593  * @param iv           [in] Initialization vector (must be of AES_BLOCK_SIZE 
00594  * in length). It is placed after ESP header in the output packet
00595  * @param input        [in] Pointer to the input payload (to be encrypted)
00596  * @param inputlen     [in] Length of input data (in bytes) pointed to by 
00597  * input parameter. The inputlen should be a multiple of AES block size. 
00598  * This function doesn't pad anything at the end of the input.
00599  * @param output       [out] Pointer to the output buffer where encrypted and 
00600  * authenticated packet should be placed
00601  * @param outputlen    [in/out] Length of output buffer (in bytes). The 
00602  * function returns the number of bytes placed in the output buffer. If output 
00603  * buffer provided is too small, no operation is performed and the size of 
00604  * output buffer required to perform the operation is placed in this parameter.
00605  * @return             AES_CBC_SHA_SUCCESS (0)
00606  *                     AES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-1)
00607  *                     AES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_KEYLENGTH (-2)
00608  *                     AES_CBC_SHA_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL (-3)
00609 */
00610   int AES_cbc_sha1_encrypt (uint16_t aes_keylen, uint8_t * aes_key,
00611     uint16_t sha1_keylen, uint8_t * sha1_key, uint8_t * espheader,
00612     uint8_t * iv, uint8_t * input, uint16_t inputlen, uint8_t * output,
00613     uint16_t * outputlen);
00614 /**
00615  * AES-CBC-SHA1 Decryption
00616  * This function authenticates & decrypts an inbound IPSEC packet using 
00617  * the AES-CBC and HMAC-SHA1 keys provided
00618  * @param aes_keylen   [in] AES CBC decryption key length
00619  * @param aes_key      [in] AES CBC decryption key
00620  * @param sha1_keylen [in] HMAC-SHA1 key length
00621  * @param sha1_key     [in] HMAC-SHA1 key
00622  * @param iv           [in] Initialization vector (must be of AES_BLOCK_SIZE 
00623  * in length).
00624  * @param input        [in] Pointer to the IPSEC packet (i.e, points to 
00625  * ESP header)
00626  * @param inputlen     [in] Length of IPSEC packet pointed to by input. It 
00627  * should include the i
00628  * ESP header (8 bytes) + IV (AES_BLOCK_SIZE) + PAYLOAD length + HMAC (12 bytes)
00629  * @param output       [out] Pointer to the output buffer where decrypted and 
00630  * authenticated packet should be placed
00631  * @param outputlen    [in/out] Length of output buffer (in bytes). The 
00632  * function returns the number of bytes placed in the output buffer. If 
00633  * output buffer provided  is too small, no operation is performed and the 
00634  * size of output buffer required to perform the operation is placed in 
00635  * this parameter.
00636  * @param compdigest   If this is non-zero, then the IPSEC packet is 
00637  * authenticated first. If the authentication succeeds, then the packet is 
00638  * decrypted.If this is 0, then the IPSEC packet is not authenticated. The 
00639  * IPSEC packet is decrypted and HMAC is placed at the end of the decrypted 
00640  * packet.
00641  * @return             AES_CBC_SHA_SUCCESS (0)
00642  *                     AES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-1)
00643  *                     AES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_KEYLENGTH (-2)
00644  *                     AES_CBC_SHA_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL (-3)
00645 */
00646   int AES_cbc_sha1_decrypt (uint16_t aes_keylen, uint8_t * aes_key,
00647     uint16_t sha1_keylen, uint8_t * sha1_key, uint8_t * iv,
00648     uint8_t * input, uint16_t inputlen, uint8_t * output,
00649     uint16_t * outputlen, uint8_t compdigest);
00650 /** 
00651  * AES-CBC-SHA224 Encryption
00652  * This function creates an IPSEC outbound packet using AES-CBC & HMAC-SHA224 
00653  * keys provided
00654  * @param aes_keylen   [in] AES CBC encryption key length
00655  * @param aes_key      [in] AES CBC encryption key
00656  * @param sha224_keylen [in] HMAC-SHA224 key length
00657  * @param sha224_key     [in] HMAC-SHA224 key
00658  * @param espheader    [in] Pointer to the ESP header (must be of 8 bytes in 
00659  * length). It is placed at the start of the output packet
00660  * @param iv           [in] Initialization vector (must be of AES_BLOCK_SIZE 
00661  * in length). It is placed after ESP header in the output packet
00662  * @param input        [in] Pointer to the input payload (to be encrypted)
00663  * @param inputlen     [in] Length of input data (in bytes) pointed to by 
00664  * input parameter. The inputlen should be a multiple of AES block size. 
00665  * This function doesn't pad anything at the end of the input.
00666  * @param output       [out] Pointer to the output buffer where encrypted 
00667  * and authenticated packet should be placed
00668  * @param outputlen    [in/out] Length of output buffer (in bytes). The 
00669  * function returns the number of bytes placed in the output buffer. If 
00670  * output buffer provided is too small, no operation is performed and the 
00671  * size of output buffer required to perform the operation is placed in this 
00672  * parameter
00673  * @return             AES_CBC_SHA_SUCCESS (0)
00674  *                     AES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-1)
00675  *                     AES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_KEYLENGTH (-2)
00676  *                     AES_CBC_SHA_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL (-3)
00677 */
00678   int AES_cbc_sha224_encrypt (uint16_t aes_keylen, uint8_t * aes_key,
00679     uint16_t sha224_keylen, uint8_t * sha224_key, uint8_t * espheader,
00680     uint8_t * iv, uint8_t * input, uint16_t inputlen, uint8_t * output,
00681     uint16_t * outputlen);
00682 /**
00683  * AES-CBC-SHA224 Decryption
00684  * This function authenticates & decrypts an inbound IPSEC packet using the 
00685  * AES-CBC and HMAC-SHA224 keys provided

00691  * in length).

00693  * header)

00695  * should include the 
00696  * ESP header (8 bytes) + IV (AES_BLOCK_SIZE) + PAYLOAD length + HMAC (12 bytes)

00698  * authenticated packet should be placed
00699  * @param outputlen    [in/out] Length of output buffer (in bytes). The 
00700  * function returns the number of bytes placed in the output buffer. If output 
00701  * buffer provided is too small, no operation is performed and the size of 
00702  * output buffer required to perform the operation is placed in this parameter
00703  * @param compdigest   If this is non-zero, then the IPSEC packet is 
00704  * authenticated first. If the authentication succeeds, then the packet is 
00705  * decrypted. If this is 0, then the IPSEC packet is not authenticated. The 
00706  * IPSEC packet is decrypted and HMAC is placed at the end of the decrypted 
00707  * packet
00708  * @return             AES_CBC_SHA_SUCCESS (0)
00709  *                     AES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-1)
00710  *                     AES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_KEYLENGTH (-2)
00711  *                     AES_CBC_SHA_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL (-3)
00712 */
00713   int AES_cbc_sha224_decrypt (uint16_t aes_keylen, uint8_t * aes_key,
00714     uint16_t sha224_keylen, uint8_t * sha224_key, uint8_t * iv,
00715     uint8_t * input, uint16_t inputlen, uint8_t * output,

00882 /**
00883  * AES-CBC-SHA512 Decryption
00884  * This function authenticates & decrypts an inbound IPSEC packet using the 
00885  * AES-CBC and HMAC-SHA512 keys provided
00886  * @param aes_keylen   [in] AES CBC decryption key length
00887  * @param aes_key      [in] AES CBC decryption key

00889  * @param sha512_key     [in] HMAC-SHA512 key
00890  * @param iv           [in] Initialization vector (must be of AES_BLOCK_SIZE 
00891  * in length).

00893  * header)
00894  * @param inputlen     [in] Length of IPSEC packet pointed to by input. It 
00895  * should include the 
00896  * ESP header (8 bytes) + IV (AES_BLOCK_SIZE) + PAYLOAD length + HMAC (12 bytes)
00897  * @param output       [out] Pointer to the output buffer where decrypted and i
00898  * authenticated packet should be placed
00899  * @param outputlen    [in/out] Length of output buffer (in bytes). The 
00900  * function returns the number of bytes placed in the output buffer. If output 
00901  * buffer provided is too small, no operation is performed and the size of 
00902  * output buffer required to perform the operation is placed in this parameter
00903  * @param compdigest   If this is non-zero, then the IPSEC packet is 
00904  * authenticated first. If the authentication succeeds, then the packet is 
00905  * decrypted. If this is 0, then the IPSEC packet is not authenticated. The 
00906  * IPSEC packet is decrypted and HMAC is placed at the end of the decrypted 
00907  * packet
00908  * @return             AES_CBC_SHA_SUCCESS (0)
00909  *                     AES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-1)
00910  *                     AES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_KEYLENGTH (-2)
00911  *                     AES_CBC_SHA_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL (-3)
00912 */
00913   int AES_cbc_sha512_decrypt (uint16_t aes_keylen, uint8_t * aes_key,
00914     uint16_t sha512_keylen, uint8_t * sha512_key, uint8_t * iv,
00915     uint8_t * input, uint16_t inputlen, uint8_t * output,
00916     uint16_t * outputlen, uint8_t compdigest);
00917 
00918 #define AES_CTR_SHA_SUCCESS             0
00919 #define AES_CTR_SHA_INVALID_ARGUMENT   -1
00920 #define AES_CTR_SHA_INVALID_KEYLENGTH  -2
00921 #define AES_CTR_SHA_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL   -3

00923 /** 
00924  * AES-CNTR-SHA1 Encryption
00925  * This function creates an IPSEC outbound packet using AES-CNTR & HMAC-SHA1 
00926  * keys provided
00927  * @param aes_ctr_key  [in] AES-CNTR encryption key
00928  * @param aes_ctr_keylen [in] AES-CNTR key length
00929  * @param aes_ctr_nonce [in] value of nonce (Refer RFC 3686)
00930  * @param sha1_keylen [in] HMAC-SHA1 key length
00931  * @param sha1_key     [in] HMAC-SHA1 key
00932  * @param espheader    [in] Pointer to the ESP header (must be of 8 bytes in 
00933  * length). It is placed at the start of the output packet
00934  * @param iv           [in] Initialization vector(must be of 8 bytes in length).
00935  *                     It is placed after ESP header in the output packet
00936  * @param input        [in] Pointer to the input payload (to be encrypted)
00937  * @param inputlen     [in] Length of input data (in bytes) pointed to by 
00938  * input parameter. The inputlen should be a multiple of AES block size. This 
00939  * function doesn't pad anything at the end of the input
00940  * @param output       [out] Pointer to the output buffer where encrypted and 
00941  * authenticated packet should be placed
00942  * @param outputlen    [in/out] Length of output buffer (in bytes). The 
00943  * function returns the number of bytes placed in the output buffer. If 
00944  * output buffer provided is too small, no operation is performed and the 
00945  * size of output buffer required to perform the operation is placed in 
00946  * this parameter
00947  * @return             AES_CTR_SHA_SUCCESS (0)
00948  *                     AES_CTR_SHA_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-1)
00949  *                     AES_CTR_SHA_INVALID_KEYLENGTH (-2)
00950  *                     AES_CTR_SHA_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL (-3)
00951 */
00952   int AES_ctr_sha1_encrypt (uint64_t * aes_ctr_key,
00953     uint32_t aes_ctr_keylen, uint32_t aes_ctr_nonce, uint16_t sha1_keylen,
00954     uint8_t * sha1_key, uint8_t * espheader, uint8_t * iv, uint8_t * input,
00955     uint16_t inputlen, uint8_t * output, uint16_t * outputlen);
00956 /** 
00957  * AES-CNTR-SHA1 Decryption
00958  * This function authenticates & decrypts an inbound IPSEC packet using the 
00959  * AES-CNTR  and HMAC-SHA512 keys provided
00960  * @param aes_ctr_key  [in] AES-CNTR encryption key
00961  * @param aes_ctr_keylen [in] AES-CNTR key length
00962  * @param aes_ctr_nonce [in] value of nonce (Refer RFC 3686)
00963  * @param sha1_keylen [in] HMAC-SHA1 key length
00964  * @param sha1_key     [in] HMAC-SHA1 key
00965  * @param iv           Initialization vector (must be of 8 bytes in length).
00966  * @param input        Pointer to the IPSEC packet (i.e, points to ESP header)
00967  * @param inputlen     Length of IPSEC packet pointed to by input. It should 
00968  * include the 
00969  * ESP header (8 bytes) + IV (AES_BLOCK_SIZE) + PAYLOAD length + HMAC (12 bytes)
00970  * @param output       Pointer to the output buffer where decrypted and 
00971  * authenticated packet should be placed
00972  * @param outputlen    Length of output buffer (in bytes). The function 
00973  * returns the number of bytes placed in the output buffer. If output buffer 
00974  * provided is too small, no operation is performed and the size of output 
00975  * buffer required to perform the operation is placed in this buffer
00976  * @param compdigest   If this is non-zero, then the IPSEC packet is 
00977  * authenticated first. If the authentication succeeds, then the packet is 
00978  * decrypted. If this is 0, then the IPSEC packet is not authenticated. 
00979  * The IPSEC packet is decrypted and HMAC is placed at the end of the 
00980  * decrypted packet
00981  * @return             AES_CTR_SHA_SUCCESS (0)
00982  *                     AES_CTR_SHA_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-1)
00983  *                     AES_CTR_SHA_INVALID_KEYLENGTH (-2)
00984  *                     AES_CTR_SHA_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL (-3)
00985 */
00986   int AES_ctr_sha1_decrypt (uint64_t * aes_ctr_key,
00987     uint32_t aes_ctr_keylen, uint32_t aes_ctr_nonce, uint16_t sha1_keylen,
00988     uint8_t * sha1_key, uint8_t * iv, uint8_t * input, uint16_t inputlen,
00989     uint8_t * output, uint16_t * outputlen, uint8_t compdigest);
